tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
get.summary: Gets a list of supported locales for datasets.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
get.summary: Gets a list of datasets for the authenticated subscription.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A filtering expression for selecting a subset of the available datasets.
            - Supported properties: displayName, description, createdDateTime, lastActionDateTime, status, locale, kind.
            - Operators:
              - eq, ne are supported for all properties.
              - gt, ge, lt, le are supported for createdDateTime and lastActionDateTime.
              - and, or, not are supported.
            -Example:
             filter=createdDateTime gt 2022-02-01T11:00:00Z and displayName eq 'My dataset'

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
post.summary: Uploads and creates a new dataset by getting the data from a specified URL or starts waiting for data blocks to be uploaded.

201.description: The response contains information about the entity as payload and its location as header.

Location.description: The location of the created resource.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
get.summary: Gets the dataset identified by the given ID.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:

requestBody.description: The updated values for the dataset.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:

204.description: The dataset was successfully deleted or did not exist.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
get.summary: Gets the list of uploaded blocks for this dataset.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
put.summary: Upload a block of data for the dataset. The maximum size of the block is 8MiB.

parameters.name: blockid
parameters.description: A valid Base64 string value that identifies the block. Prior to encoding, the string must be less than or equal to 64 bytes in size. For a given blob, the length of the value specified for the blockid parameter must be the same size for each block. Note that the Base64 string must be URL-encoded.

201.description: The data block was uploaded successfully.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
post.summary: Uploads data and creates a new dataset.

project.description: The optional string representation of the url of a project. If set, the dataset will be associated with that project.

kind.description: The kind of the dataset. Possible values are "Language", "Acoustic", "Pronunciation", "AudioFiles", "LanguageMarkdown", "OutputFormatting".

customProperties.description: The optional custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

data.description: For acoustic datasets, a zip file containing the audio data and a text file containing the transcriptions for the audio data. For language datasets, a text file containing the language or pronunciation data. Required in both cases.

email.description: An optional string containing the email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes. The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

201.description: The response contains information about the entity as payload and its location as header.

Location.description: The location of the created resource.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
post.summary: Commit block list to complete the upload of the dataset.

requestBody.description: The list of blocks that compile the dataset.

200.description: The block list is accepted and the data import process can continue.

tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
get.summary: Gets the files of the dataset identified by the given ID.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A filtering expression for selecting a subset of the available files.
            - Supported properties: name, createdDateTime, kind.
            - Operators:
              - eq, ne are supported for all properties.
              - gt, ge, lt, le are supported for createdDateTime.
              - and, or, not are supported.
            - Example:
              filter=name eq 'myaudio.wav' and kind eq 'Audio'

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

get.summary: Gets the list of audio and transcription logs that have been stored for a given endpoint.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Token to skip logs that were already retrieved in previous requests. Pagination starts from beginning when not defined.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified audio and transcription logs that have been stored for a given endpoint. It deletes all logs before (and including) a specific day.
delete.description: The deletion process is done asynchronously and can take up to one day depending on the amount of log files.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
The end date of the audio logs deletion (specific day, UTC).
            Expected format: "yyyy-mm-dd". For instance, "2023-03-15" results in deleting all logs on March 15th, 2023 and before.
            Deletes all existing logs when date is not specified.

get.summary: Gets a specific audio or transcription log for a given endpoint.

delete.summary: Deletes one audio or transcription log that have been stored for a given endpoint.

get.summary: Gets the list of audio and transcription logs that have been stored when using the default base model of a given language.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The language used to select the default base model.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Token to skip logs that were already retrieved in previous requests. Pagination starts from beginning when not defined.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified audio and transcription logs that have been stored when using the default base model of a given language. It deletes all logs before (and including) a specific day.
delete.description: Deletion process is done asynchronously and can take up to one day depending on the amount of log files.

parameters.name: locale

post.summary: Copies a model from one subscription to another.
post.description:
This method can be used to copy a model from this speech resource to a target one.
The authorization is obtained on the target speech resource.
Only custom models can be copied to another speech resource.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the model that will be copied.

requestBody.description: The body contains the authorization to copy to the target speech resource.

202.description: The response contains information about the entity as payload and its location as header.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before accessing the resource created in this operation.

Operation-Location.description: The location of the operation to track progress.

post.summary: Allows another speech resource (source) to copy a model to this speech resource (target).
post.description:
This method can be used to allow copying a model from another speech resource.
Only custom models can be copied from another speech resource.

requestBody.description: The body contains the Azure Resource ID of the source speech resource.

200.description: The response contains information about the entity as payload and its location as header.

A filtering expression for selecting a subset of the available hooks.
            Supported properties: displayName, description, createdDateTime, lastActionDateTime, status and webUrl.
            - Operators:

              - and, or, not are supported.
            - Example:
              filter=displayName eq 'test'

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

post.description:
If the property secret in the configuration is present and contains a non-empty string, it will be used to create a SHA256 hash of the payload with
the secret as HMAC key. This hash will be set as X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header when calling back into the registered URL.
            
When calling back into the registered URL, the request will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Event header containing one of the registered event
types. There will be one request per registered event type.
            
After successfully registering the web hook, it will not be usable until a challenge/response is completed. To do this, a request with the event type
challenge will be made with a query parameter called validationToken. Respond to the challenge with a 200 OK containing the value of the validationToken
query parameter as the response body. When the challenge/response is successfully completed, the web hook will begin receiving events.

requestBody.description: The details of the new web hook.

201.description: The response contains information about the entity as payload and its location as header.

Location.description: The location of the created resource.

get.summary: Gets the web hook identified by the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the web hook.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

patch.summary: Updates the web hook identified by the given ID.
patch.description:
If the property secret in the configuration is omitted or contains an empty string, future callbacks won't contain X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature
headers. If the property contains a non-empty string, it will be used to create a SHA256 hash of the payload with the secret as HMAC key. This hash
will be set as X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header when calling back into the registered URL.
            
If the URL changes,  the web hook will stop receiving events until a
challenge/response is completed. To do this, a request with the event type challenge will be made with a query parameter called validationToken.
Respond to the challenge with a 200 OK containing the value of the validationToken query parameter as the response body. When the challenge/response
is successfully completed, the web hook will begin receiving events.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the web hook.

requestBody.description: The updated values for the web hook.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

delete.summary: Deletes the web hook identified by the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the web hook.

204.description: The web hook was successfully deleted.

post.summary: Sends a ping event to the registered URL.
post.description:
The request body of the POST request sent to the registered web hook URL is of the same shape as in the GET request for a specific hook.
The Swagger Schema ID of the model is WebHookV3.
            
The request will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Event header with the value ping. If the web hook was registered with
a secret it will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header with an SHA256 hash of the payload with
the secret as HMAC key. The hash is base64 encoded.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the web hook to ping.

202.description: Started trying to send a ping request to the web hook.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before accessing the resource created in this operation.

post.summary: Sends a request for each registered event type to the registered URL.
post.description:
The payload will be generated from the last entity that would have invoked the web hook. If no entity is present for none of the registered event types,
the POST will respond with 204. If a test request can be made, it will respond with 200.
The request will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Event header with the respective registered event type.
If the web hook was registered with a secret it will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header with an SHA256 hash of the payload with
the secret as HMAC key. The hash is base64 encoded.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the web hook to ping.

202.description: A test request with the last entity is sent to the registered web hook.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before accessing the resource created in this operation.

204.description: No entity could be found for any event type, so no test request is sent to the registered web hook.

adaptationDateTime.description: The date when adaptation becomes deprecated.

transcriptionDateTime.description: The date when transcription becomes deprecated.

supportsAdaptationsWith.description: Supported dataset kinds to adapt the model.

manifest.description: The location to get a manifest for this model to be used in the on-prem container. See operation "Models_GetCustomModelManifest" for more details.

chargeForAdaptation.description: A value indicating whether model adaptation is charged.

values.description: A data block from the committed block list.
A data block from the uncommitted block list.
A data block from the uncommitted block list, if present, otherwise from the committed block list.

CommitBlocksEntry.title: CommitBlocksEntry
CommitBlocksEntry.description: Entry of the commit block list.

text.description: The text used to adapt this language model.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

transcriptionDateTime.description: The date when transcription becomes deprecated.

copy.description: The location to the model copy action. See operation "Models_Copy" for more details.

files.description: The location to get all files of this entity. See operation "Models_ListFiles" for more details.

manifest.description: The location to get a manifest for this model to be used in the on-prem container. See operation "Models_GetCustomModelManifest" for more details.

customModelWeightPercent.description:
The weight of custom model between 1 (1% custom model and 99% base model) and 100 (100% custom model and 0% base model).
When this property is not set, the service chooses a suitable value (get the model to retrieve the selected weight).
Start without using this property. If needed, choose a larger (or smaller) weight to increase (or decrease) the impact of the custom model.

email.description:
The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

displayName.description: The display name of the object.

contentUrl.description: The URL of the data for the dataset.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

locale.description: The locale of the contained data.

lastActionDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the current status was entered.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

createdDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the object was created.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

values.description: Dataset that contains rules to customize inverse text normalization, capitalization, reformulation, profanity and also defines tests for dataset validation

files.description: The location to get all files of this entity. See operation "Datasets_ListFiles" for more details.

commitBlocks.description: The location to commit the list of blocks when uploading a dataset using blocks. See operation "Datasets_CommitBlocks" for more details.

listBlocks.description: The location to list the already uploaded blocks of this entity when uploading a dataset using blocks. See operation "Datasets_GetBlocks" for more details.

uploadBlocks.description: The location to upload blocks to when uploading a dataset using blocks. See operation "Datasets_UploadBlock" for more details.

acceptedLineCount.description: The number of lines accepted for this data set.

rejectedLineCount.description: The number of lines rejected for this data set.

duration.description:
The total duration of the datasets if it contains audio files. The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration
("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

email.description:
The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

values.description: Only one of urls or container or dataset.

minCount.description: A hint for the minimum number of speakers for diarization. Must be smaller than or equal to the maxSpeakers property.

maxCount.description: The maximum number of speakers for diarization. Must be less than 36 and larger than or equal to the minSpeakers property.

numberOfEdits.description: The optional number of edits for a given type of error of the recognized transcription in comparison with the human transcription.

percentageOfAllEdits.description: The optional percentage of edits for a given type of error of the recognized transcription in comparison with the human transcription.

displayName.description: The display name of the object.

text.description: The text used to adapt a language model for this endpoint.

locale.description: The locale of the contained data.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

lastActionDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the current status was entered.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

createdDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the object was created.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

restInteractive.description: The REST endpoint for short requests up to 15 seconds.

restConversation.description: The REST endpoint for requests up to 60 seconds.

restDictation.description: The REST endpoint for requests up to 60 seconds, supporting dictation of punctuation marks.

webSocketInteractive.description: The Speech SDK endpoint for short requests up to 15 seconds with a single final result.

webSocketConversation.description: The Speech SDK endpoint for long requests with multiple final results.

webSocketDictation.description:
The Speech SDK endpoint for long requests with multiple final results, supporting dictation of
punctuation marks.

logs.description: The audio and transcription logs for this endpoint.  See operation "Endpoints_ListLogs" for more details.

loggingEnabled.description: A value indicating whether content logging (audio & transcriptions) is being used for a deployment.

timeToLive.description:
How long the endpoint will be kept in the system. Once the endpoint reaches the time to live
after completion (successful or failed) it will be automatically deleted. Not setting this value or setting
to 0 will disable automatic deletion. The longest supported duration is 31 days.
The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration ("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

contentLoggingEnabled.description:
A value indicating whether content logging (audio & transcriptions)
is being used for a deployment.

LanguageIdentificationMode.title: LanguageIdentificationMode
LanguageIdentificationMode.description: The mode used for language identification.

values.description: Single language identification. If no language can be identified, the error code NoLanguageIdentified is returned to the user. If there is ambiguity between multiple languages, the error code MultipleLanguagesIdentified is returned to the user.

candidateLocales.description: The candidate locales for language identification (example ["en-US", "de-DE", "es-ES"]). A minimum of 2 and a maximum of 10 candidate locales, including the main locale for the transcription, is supported for continuous mode. For single language identification, the maximum number of candidate locales is unbounded.

speechModelMapping.description:
An optional mapping of locales to speech model entities. If no model is given for a locale, the default base model is used.
Keys must be locales contained in the candidate locales, values are entities for models of the respective locales.

targetResourceRegion.description: The region (aka location) of the target speech resource (e.g., westus2).

targetResourceId.description: The Azure Resource ID of the target speech resource.

targetResourceEndpoint.description: The endpoint (base url) of the target resource (with custom domain name when it is used).

sourceResourceId.description: The Azure Resource ID of the source speech resource.

expirationDateTime.description: The expiration date of this copy authorization.

id.description: The ID of this copy authorization.

sourceResourceId.description: The Azure Resource ID of the source speech resource.

modelFiles.description: The model files of this model.

properties.description: The configuration for running this model in a container.

supportsTranscriptions.description: A value indicating whether batch transcription is supported.

supportsEndpoints.description: A value indicating whether creation of endpoints for live transcription is supported.

supportsTranscriptionsOnSpeechContainers.description: A value indicating whether this model can be used for transcription on speech container. This feature can be added on existing models when it becomes usable on speech container.

Status.title: Status
Status.description: Describe the current state of the API.

values.description: The long running operation has not yet started.
The long running operation is currently processing.
The long running operation has successfully completed.
The long running operation has failed.
Default text normalization (e.g. '2 to 3' is replaced by 'two to three' in en-US).
No text normalization will be applied to the input text. This is an override option that should only be used when text is normalized before the upload.

contentUrls.description:
A list of content urls to get audio files to transcribe. Up to 1000 urls are allowed.
This property will not be returned in a response.

contentContainerUrl.description:
A URL for an Azure blob container that contains the audio files. A container is allowed to have a maximum size of 5GB and a maximum number of 10000 blobs.
The maximum size for a blob is 2.5GB.
Container SAS should contain 'r' (read) and 'l' (list) permissions.
This property will not be returned in a response.

locale.description: The locale of the contained data. If Language Identification is used, this locale is used to transcribe speech for which no language could be detected.

displayName.description: The display name of the object.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

lastActionDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the current status was entered.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

createdDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the object was created.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

files.description: The location to get all files of this entity. See operation "Transcriptions_ListFiles" for more details.

wordLevelTimestampsEnabled.description:
A value indicating whether word level timestamps are requested. The default value is
`false`.

displayFormWordLevelTimestampsEnabled.description: A value indicating whether word level timestamps for the display form are requested. The default value is `false`.

duration.description:
The duration of the transcription. The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration
("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

channels.description:
A collection of the requested channel numbers.
In the default case, the channels 0 and 1 are considered.

destinationContainerUrl.description:
The requested destination container.
### Remarks ###
When a destination container is used in combination with a `timeToLive`, the metadata of a
transcription will be deleted normally, but the data stored in the destination container, including
transcription results, will remain untouched, because no delete permissions are required for this
container.

To support automatic cleanup, either configure blob lifetimes on the container, or use "Bring your own Storage (BYOS)"
instead of `destinationContainerUrl`, where blobs can be cleaned up.

timeToLive.description:
How long the transcription will be kept in the system after it has completed. Once the
transcription reaches the time to live after completion (successful or failed) it will be automatically
deleted. Not setting this value or setting it to 0 will disable automatic deletion. The longest supported
duration is 31 days.
The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration ("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

email.description:
The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

diarizationEnabled.description:
A value indicating whether diarization (speaker identification) is requested. The default value
is `false`.
If this field is set to true and the improved diarization system is configured by specifying
`DiarizationProperties`, the improved diarization system will provide diarization for a configurable
range of speakers.
If this field is set to true and the improved diarization system is not enabled (not specifying
`DiarizationProperties`), the basic diarization system will distinguish between up to two speakers.
No extra charges are applied for the basic diarization.
            
The basic diarization system is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version of the API.
This `diarizationEnabled` setting will also be removed.

The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

committedBlocks.description: The block description of blocks already committed.

uncommittedBlocks.description: The block description of blocks not committed to the blob.

ping.description: The URL that can be used to trigger the sending of a ping event to the registered URL of a web hook registration. See operation "WebHooks_Ping" for more details.

test.description: The URL that can be used sending test events to the registered URL of a web hook registration. See operation "WebHooks_Test" for more details.

apiVersion.description:
The API version the web hook was created in. This defines the shape of the payload in the callbacks.
If the payload type is not supported anymore, because the shape changed and the API version using it is removed (after deprecation),
the web hook will be disabled.

secret.description:
A secret that will be used to create a SHA256 hash of the payload with the secret as HMAC key.
This hash will be set as X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header when calling back into the registered URL.

A secret that will be used to create a SHA256 hash of the payload with the secret as HMAC key.
This hash will be set as X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header when calling back into the registered URL.

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example: https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).

skipQueryParameter.name: skip
skipQueryParameter.description: Number of datasets that will be skipped.

topQueryParameter.name: top
topQueryParameter.description: Number of datasets that will be included after skipping.

sasValidityQueryParameter.name: sasValidityInSeconds
sasValidityQueryParameter.description: The duration in seconds that an SAS url should be valid. The default duration is 12 hours. When using BYOS (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/speech-service/speech-encryption-of-data-at-rest#bring-your-own-storage-byos-for-customization-and-logging): A value of 0 means that a plain blob URI without SAS token will be generated.

token.description: Provide an access token from the JWT returned by the STS of this region. Make sure to add the management scope to the token by adding the following query string to the STS URL: ?scope=speechservicesmanagement
token.name: Authorization
